intro: Cacalia calotricha, commonly known as the silverleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, silver-green leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Cacalia calotricha is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
